title.narrative: Afrique du Sud – Renforcement des Capacités Statistiques (SCB II) dans les Pays Membres Régionaux pour le Suivi des OMD et la Mesure des Résultats
South Africa – Statistical Capacity Building (SCB II) in Regional Member Countries for MDG Monitoring and Results Measurement

description.narrative: Les principaux bénéficiaires du programme sont les producteurs et utilisateurs des statistiques officielles, les décideurs nationaux, le secteur privé, les chercheurs et au public, ainsi que les partenaires au développement aux niveaux national, régional et international.

The main beneficiaries of the programme are the producers and users of official statistics, national policy-makers, the private sector, researchers and the public, as well as development partners at national, regional and international levels.

L’objectif du programme est d’aider le pays à améliorer le Système statistique national (SSN) afin de fournir des données de qualité, fiables et opportunes. Ceci permettrait de contribuer à une gestion économique plus efficace, à un meilleur suivi des OMD/ODD et de la pauvreté, à une politique éclairée basée sur des données probantes, et également aux améliorations de la conception des programmes et projets de la Banque.

The original program development objective is to assist the country to improve the National Statistical System (NSS) in order to provide high quality, reliable and timely data. This would contribute to more effective economic management, better MDGs/SDGs and poverty monitoring, informed evidence-based policy making as well as to contributing to improvements in the design of future Bank programs and projects.

La présente intervention est relative au Renforcement des Capacités Statistiques (SCB II) dans les Pays Membres Régionaux pour le Suivi des OMD et la Mesure des Résultats. Elle a été conçue en vue d’aider l’Afrique du Sud à améliorer son Système statistique national (SSN). En renforçant les capacités statistiques, le programme prevoyait contribuer à l’amélioration du suivi des progrès réalisés pour atteindre les OMD (désormais appelés ODD) et aux efforts de réduction de la pauvreté. Le projet devrait être utile aux producteurs et aux utilisateurs des statistiques officielles, aux décideurs nationaux, au secteur privé, aux chercheurs et au public, et également aux partenaires au développement aux niveaux national, régional et international. Les résultats du programme devraient apporter une contribution très importante en renforçant la création de nouvelles opportunités d’affaires dans le secteur public et le secteur privé en Afrique du Sud. Ces résultats devraient également permettre à la Banque de générer une solide réserve de programmes et de projets à financer en Afrique du Sud. Le programme comprend quatre principales composantes, à savoir : (1) l’appui des activités suivantes : (i) le programme de comparaison internationale (PCI) ; (ii) la stratégie nationale de développement de la statistique (SNDS) et (iii) le registre statistique des entreprises (RSE); (2) l’amélioration des statistiques sociales, l’évaluation et l’analyse de la pauvreté ; (3) l’amélioration les statistiques dans les domaines d’intervention prioritaires; (4) la gestion, l’archivage et la diffusion des données.

The present intervention relates to Statistical Capacity Building (SCB II) in Regional Member Countries for MDG Monitoring and Results Measurement. It’s designed to assist South Africa to improve its National Statistical System (NSS). By building statistical capacity, the programme planned to contribute to improved monitoring of progress towards the MDGs (now called MDGs) and poverty reduction efforts. The project is expected to benefit producers and users of official statistics, national policy-makers, the private sector, researchers and the public, as well as development partners at the national, regional and international levels. The results of the programme are expected to make a very important contribution in strengthening the creation of new business opportunities in the public and private sectors in South Africa. These results should also enable the Bank to generate a strong pipeline of programmes and projects for financing in South Africa. The program has four main components, namely : (1) support for the following activities : (i) the International Comparison Programme (ICP); (ii) the National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS) and (iii) the Statistical Business Register (SBSR); (2) improving social statistics, poverty assessment and analysis; (3) improving statistics in priority areas of intervention; and (4) data management, archiving and dissemination.

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

description.narrative: Total Disbursement in Fourth Quarter of 2015
Total Disbursement in Second Quarter of 2014

receiver-org.narrative: GOVERNMENT OF SOUTH AFRICA MINISTRY OF FINANCE, DEPT. OF FINANCE

title.narrative: Strong data management and archiving system, able to meet data needs of varying stakeholders

target.value: Live, centralized multipurpose data portal providing timely and reliable data including for monitoring and evaluation of the performance of South Africa’s economy; Strong analytical capacity to produce timely and reliable information for monitoring MDGs (SDGs), service delivery, other national policy

actual.value: In addition to Publication Services archiving system that stores microdata & macrodata and metadata, StatsSA also launched the UMKHANYAKUDE (translated as light from afar) a data portal with municipal pages, thematic pages

title.narrative: Increased reliability of poverty, employment and other quality of life indicators that are sufficiently gender, age and geographically disaggregated

target.value: That household surveys including QES and other sociodemographic statistics are regularly produced. Good national accounts statistics including QNA and SUTs. SDDS compliance

actual.value: South Africa conducts regular household income and expenditure surveys (HIES), quarterly employment surveys (QES), and produces other high quality sociodemographic statistics; StatsSA is able to provide high level gender, age & geographically disaggregated data

title.narrative: Participation in the International Comparison Program (ICP)

target.value: Fully integrate ICP in CPI data collection for household expenditure and consumption and methodology of product specifications for common products in ICP and CPI

actual.value: South Africa participated in the 2011 and 2017 Rounds of ICP as well as the 2015/2016 pilot.

target.value: A robust SBR to support development of economic statistics

actual.value: Stats SA has been a leader on Statistical Business Registers, has been supporting other countries inStats SA has been a leader on Statistical Business Registers, has been supporting other countries in developing their SBRs and was instrumental in the development of the SBR Guidelines for Africa sponsored by the Bank

target.value: A strong Statistics Act that provides for sector coordination and an NSDS

actual.value: StatsSA decided to revisit the Statistics Act that was not believed to be strong enough on a key element of the NSDS - “sector coordination.” A new Statistics Act is currently going through a consultative process will be promulgated in 2019

target.value: A strong infrastructure statistics program to provide reliable estimates of infrastructure needs for South Africa

actual.value: StatsSA has been a part of AIKP since 2011 collecting data on energy, transport and financial flows

target.value: Production of sufficiently gender, age and geographically disaggregated data. Produce regular reports on gender

actual.value: StatsSA led work on development of the methodology for measuring individual level asset ownership and control, and entrepreneurship through the EDGE Project (Evidence and Data for Gender Equality). It has also successfully mainstreamed gender in a wide range of statistical activities.

title.narrative: Improved data management, archiving and dissemination

target.value: A live, centralized multipurpose data portal providing timely and reliable data including for monitoring and evaluation of the performance of South Africa’s economy

actual.value: StatsSA maintains a comprehensive data management, archiving and dissemination system through the Publication Services Department. This provides online microdata, macrodata and metadata of all data produced by StatsSA.

title.narrative: Household Income and Expenditure Surveys & General Household Surveys

target.value: Increased frequency of Household Surveys to allow more accurate computation of estimates of poverty distribution and poverty mapping, other welfare indicators, and allow timely revisions of the CPI basket and National Accounts

actual.value: StatsSA regularly undertakes HIES and GHS

target.value: Quarterly Labour Force Survey (QLFS). Fully implement 19th ICLS resolution. Have a LMIS.

actual.value: StatsSA undertakes a Quarterly Labour Force Survey (QLFS) since 2008. Not yet implemented the 19th ICLS Resolution, but follows definitions except for age. LMIS is being initiated

title.narrative: Continued leadership role for mobilizing other African countries to participate in regional public goods statistical programs such as the PHCs, CRVS, improving quality of economic statistics

target.value: Participation by all African countries in PHCs, one of the key mandates of an NSO; Significantly improved CRVS across the continent with the aim of leaving no one behind and increase use as the CRVS as a major source of data for monitoring SDGs. Increase in young statisticians trained and improvement and harmonization of African statistics.

actual.value: The ASSD annual conferences were organized on three major thematic areas namely (i) undertaking the 2010 Round of Population and Housing Censuses (PHC), (ii) development of Civil Registration and Vital Statistics, and more recently, (iii) the campaign to improve quality of Economic Statistics. Less than 5 countries did not take part in the 2010 Round of PHCs

target.value: A dynamic environment and climate change statistics program to support green growth

actual.value: There is a strong environment accounts statistics program and much progress has been made in the last 8 years. A compilation of Environment Economic Accounts Compendium has been produced each year since 2014
